sentences.english: Another problem for returning migrants is that they may not have much to return to.
sentences.chinese: 另一個返國的移民問題是，他們可能沒有多少回。

sentences.english: The delegation will be home next week.
He returned to China in 1917 and taught as a professor in Peking University.
sentences.chinese: 民國六年返國，任北京大學教授。

sentences.english: You also need to demonstrate that you plan to return home.
sentences.chinese: 您還必須表明您有計劃返國。

sentences.english: And helping to create an environment where we get jobs back in our country.
sentences.chinese: 並且幫助創造一種能在返國後找到工作的環境。

sentences.english: After his return, Mr. Ramos-Horta urged the remaining rebels to turn themselves in to face trial.
sentences.chinese: 奧爾塔總統返國之後呼籲在逃叛軍自首，面對審判。

definition: to dispatch (sb) in an official capacity/to be posted (as an ambassador, foreign correspondent etc)
to ask sb to resign from a post
to lobby/to campaign/to promote (an idea, a product)/(old) to visit various rulers and promote one's political ideas (in the Warring States period)
to expire/to run out/to come to an end
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
to practice medicine (esp. in private practice)
(Tw) to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
